dublin_core.dcvalue: Our previous studies have investigated the psychological consequences of kidnapping in a group of Italian seafarers assaulted by sea pirates and held in captivity and in their family members by the criteria of the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders DSM 4 These studies have shown that both the victims and the family members showed significant psychological disturbances corresponding to a chronic Post Traumatic Stress Disorder PTSD in the victims and a pattern of anxiety and depression in their family members After publication of these studies an updated edition of the DSM became available namely the DSM 5 The DSM 5 redefines some diagnostic criteria including those related to the PTSD This work was focused on the re evaluation of the results of our previous studies in the light of the DSM 5 diagnostic criteria
Sea piracy sequelae: assessment according to the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders-5.
